means: 无信仰者， （尤指）不信上帝、宗教等的人

sentence.Network_en: It was as if a professed unbeliever in ghosts should be frightened by a ghost story.
sentence.Network_cn: 这就像一个自称不相信有鬼的人叫鬼故事吓得心惊胆战一样.

sentence.Network_en: He used to be an unbeliever himself.
Paul was saying that certain relationships between an unbeliever and a believer will prove incompatible.
sentence.Network_cn: 保罗在这里指出,信徒与非信徒之间建立某种紧密的关系是并不相配的.

entry.def: People who do not believe in a particular religion are sometimes referred to as unbelievers .

means.word_mean: 1. someone who refuses to believe (as in a divinity)
